response: SDLC is a structured process for software development.
It includes phases: Requirement Analysis, Design, Implementation, Testing, Deployment, and Maintenance.
Models include Waterfall, Agile, Spiral, and V-Model.
Each phase has specific deliverables and objectives.
Agile promotes iterative and incremental development.
Uses sprints (short development cycles) to deliver features quickly.
Focuses on collaboration between teams and customers.
Popular Agile frameworks include Scrum and Kanban.
Reduces risks by allowing continuous feedback and improvements.
Risk management identifies and mitigates project risks.
Includes risk identification, assessment, and response planning.
Common risks: scope creep, budget overruns, and technical failures.
Strategies: Avoid, Transfer, Mitigate, or Accept risks.
